macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Jones Closes Above 50,000 for First Time Amid Tech Sell-Off and Rate Cut Hopes
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rallied over 1,200 points to close at 50,115.67 on February 6, 2026, marking a historic high driven by weak U.S. labor data boosting Federal Reserve rate cut expectations, while technology stocks faced sharp sell-offs followed by recovery amid heightened global volatility.

items.title: University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment Rises Unexpectedly, Inflation Expectations Fall
items.summary: February's preliminary Michigan survey showed consumer sentiment rising to 57.3 from 56.4, beating expectations, with one-year inflation expectations dropping sharply to 3.5% from 4.0%; Fed speakers maintained a data-driven stance ahead of delayed U.S. payrolls report.

items.title: Global Markets Shift from Tech to 'Old Economy' Sectors Amid Volatility
items.summary: Investors rotated capital from mega-cap tech stocks to Oil & Gas, Industrials, Materials, and Regional Banks due to attractive valuations and strengthening cycles; S&P 500 closed at 6,932.3 (+1.97%) and Nasdaq showed choppy action on February 6, 2026.

items.title: US ISM Manufacturing PMI Beats Expectations, Boosting Economic Outlook
items.summary: US ISM Manufacturing PMI came in considerably stronger than expected, alongside solid ISM Services PMI and stronger-than-expected consumer sentiment, providing positive signals for the U.S. economy despite dollar indecision.

items.title: Stock Futures Rise Sunday Night After Volatile Week, Ahead of Key Data
items.summary: U.S. stock futures pointed higher on February 8 evening as markets anticipated key economic data and earnings following a week of significant volatility and rotation in sectors.

items.title: Geopolitical Tensions with Iran and U.S. Tariff Threats Drive Market Sentiment
items.summary: Escalating U.S.-Iran tensions and tariff threats contributed to market volatility, with analysts predicting potential U.S. action; markets rallied late in the week amid these risks.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Reclaims $71,000 as Crypto Market Rebounds Strongly
items.summary: Bitcoin surged back above $71,000 after dipping to $60,000 last week, driven by Fed rate cut hopes, U.S. Strategic Reserve buying during the dip, and renewed investor confidence. Ethereum rose above $2,000, while XRP gained 25% in a day amid broader market recovery.[1][2][4][5]
items.source: Coingape, Blockhead, Bloomberg via RBC Ukraine, DL News

items.title: Crypto Bill Advances Toward Key Phase on February 10th
items.summary: Speculation grows that a major crypto bill could progress this week, with the White House hosting crypto firms and banks on stablecoins Tuesday and potential signing by April. This regulatory clarity is seen as a catalyst amid market volatility.[1][2]

items.title: Bithumb Glitch Temporarily Makes 695 South Koreans Billionaires
items.summary: South Korean exchange Bithumb accidentally transferred 620,000 BTC (worth $42B) to 695 users due to human error during a promo payout, causing a 20% price drop on the platform. Nearly all funds have been recovered.[6]

items.title: US Bitcoin ETFs See $221M Inflows After Sell-Off
items.summary: US Bitcoin ETFs recorded $221 million in inflows on February 6 as investors bought the dip post-sell-off, signaling big money viewing the drop as a buying opportunity amid stabilizing prices around $70K-$71K.[4]

items.title: Analysts Eye Bitcoin Push to $81,000 After Stabilizing Above $70K
items.summary: Bitcoin holds firm above $70,000 post-turbulence, with analysts targeting $73K-$75K as key resistance before potential rally to $81,000, supported by whale accumulation and purged speculative froth.[2][4]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: MIT Study Reveals Unreliability of LLM Ranking Platforms
items.summary: Researchers from MIT developed a method showing that popular platforms ranking large language models can be skewed by just a few data points, such as two votes out of 57,000 altering top rankings. The technique identifies problematic data for more reliable evaluations.

items.title: Chinese Cells and U.S. AI Reduce Battery Testing Time by 95% in Nature Study
items.summary: A collaborative study published in Nature demonstrates how U.S.-developed AI, using early test data from Chinese battery cells, slashes testing time by 95%. This breakthrough accelerates battery development significantly.

items.title: AI Analysis Flags 10% of Global Cancer Research as Potentially Fake
items.summary: An AI-led analysis in The BMJ identifies nearly 10% of cancer research papers worldwide as potentially fraudulent, highlighting issues with paper mills undermining scientific integrity.

items.title: Norway Launches First National AI Championship
items.summary: Norway is hosting its inaugural AI Championship starting March 19 in Oslo, a four-day open competition with NOK 1 million in prizes to benchmark applied AI skills and connect talent with industry.

items.title: Rockwell Automation Opens AI-Driven Cybersecurity Center in Singapore
items.summary: Rockwell Automation has launched a new Security Operations Center in Singapore providing 24/7 AI-driven threat monitoring and rapid response for industrial operations across Asia Pacific.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: HBO Expanding Video Game Adaptations With Baldur's Gate 3 Series From Craig Mazin
items.summary: HBO is developing a Baldur's Gate 3 series with showrunner Craig Mazin, though Larian Studios is not involved in the adaptation project.

items.title: Epic Games Comments on Santa Ragione's Banned Game 'Horses'
items.summary: Epic Games has addressed the removal of Santa Ragione's game 'Horses' from its platform, citing violations of multiple content guidelines.

items.title: New Video Games Launching This Week (February 9-15, 2026)
items.summary: Multiple new games are releasing across PlayStation, Xbox, and PC platforms during this week.

items.title: Report: Next Year Is 'Best Case Scenario' For New Xbox Console
items.summary: Microsoft is reportedly considering a new Xbox console release, though pricing decisions remain uncertain.

items.title: Three Xbox Games Shutting Down Servers In February & March 2026
items.summary: Multiple Xbox titles are discontinuing online services during the coming weeks.

items.title: Xbox Reportedly Releasing Brand-New Controller Revision In 2026
items.summary: Microsoft is planning to release a revised Xbox controller model this year.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tesla Considers New Sites and Major Buffalo Expansion
items.summary: Bloomberg reports Tesla is evaluating new manufacturing sites including a significant expansion in Buffalo, New York, though state officials confirm no discussions have occurred yet.

items.title: Rigetti Quantum Computing Lags in Accuracy Despite Stock Gains
items.summary: Rigetti's two-qubit gate fidelity stands at 99.5%, trailing IonQ's 99.99% and failing DARPA's Quantum Benchmarking advancement, though it secured an $8.4 million order from India's CDAC.

items.title: AutoFlight Achieves First Flight of 5-Metric-Ton Class eVTOL
items.summary: China's AutoFlight successfully flew the uncrewed Matrix eVTOL, the largest in its class, demonstrating full transition between vertical and horizontal flight.
